subject: ✅ CORRECTION: Google Geolocation Endpoints ARE LIVE - Both TEST & PROD Working!

context.issue: Correcting earlier urgent message - endpoints are actually live

message.summary: IMPORTANT CORRECTION to my earlier message: PROD Google Geolocation endpoint WAS successfully deployed today and is LIVE RIGHT NOW. Your timeouts were from yesterday before deployment.
message.correction: My earlier urgent message was partially wrong. I apologize for the confusion. While the deployment pipeline WAS broken (which I fixed), a DIFFERENT workflow successfully deployed PROD today at 20:42 UTC BEFORE I even started investigating.

actual_status.verified: Just tested both endpoints - returning valid geolocation data with HTTP 200

timeline_clarification: Oct 23: You made frontend changes and saw timeouts (endpoint didn't exist yet)
Oct 24 16:42 UTC: PROD branch merged with Google Geo endpoint
Oct 24 20:42 UTC: PROD successfully deployed via 'CalendarBEAF-PROD' workflow
Oct 24 21:40 UTC: I fixed ESLint config issue and deployed TEST with v1.7.0
Oct 24 22:00 UTC: Verified both endpoints are live and working
message.what_was_wrong: Multiple deployment workflows exist. I was looking at 'azure-functions-prod.yml' which was failing due to missing ESLint config. But 'prod_calendarbeaf-prod.yml' succeeded and deployed PROD before I investigated.
what_i_fixed: Added .eslintrc.json to fix the broken azure-functions-prod.yml workflow
Both TEST and PROD now have working Google Geolocation endpoints
action_for_you: Your frontend can NOW use the PROD endpoint immediately
The timeouts you saw yesterday should be resolved
Your v1.12.18 frontend changes should work perfectly now
No need to wait - PROD is ready!
message.apology: Sorry for the confusion in my earlier urgent message. The good news is actually better than I initially thought - PROD was already deployed and working when I started investigating. Your integration should work perfectly now!
